Dear Ms. Calcaterra:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.

ALLEGATION: Variable interval eye-on check of youth exceeding fifteen minutes.
INVESTIGATION:
I reviewed the facility’s Emergency Alarm System (Key and Phone Log) forms from
01/11/2022 through 02/07/2022 for the times of 09:00PM through 07:00AM for
SIR#2022C02190025. The form is used by the facility’s control room staff to
document each unit’s fifteen-minute checks of residents. The form contains the
fifteen-minute checks of residents for each of its licenses to include CE630201059,
which includes MP. It is reported that once staff on the unit completes a bed-check
they contact the control room through a key-check or call-in who then enters an “X”
on the form as verification of a check being done for that for fifteen-minute period.
An “0” means that a check was “Missed”, per the forms key.
2

Missed, late, or not documented checks of residents for CE630201059 (MP) is as
follows:
01/29/2022 MP 22:00, 22:15, 22:30
02/04/2022 MP 21:30, 21:45, 22:00, 22:15, 22:30, 22:45
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4127 Staff-to-resident ratio.
(4) When residents are asleep or otherwise outside of the direct
supervision of staff, staff shall perform variable interval, eye-on
checks of residents. The time between the variable interval
checks shall not exceed fifteen minutes.
ANALYSIS: There is evidence to indicate that variable interval checks of
residents do not occur every 15-minutes consistently. Review of
the facility’s Emergency Alarm System (Key and Phone Log)
forms from 01/11/2022 through 02/07/2022 for the times of
09:30PM through 07:00AM, to include building/units MP verifies
missed or not documented bed checks as occurring.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Upon receipt of an approved corrective action plan no change to the current license
is recommended.
